intro: Oenothera rubricauloides, commonly known as the red-stemmed evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has slender, reddish stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its botanical features include a taproot system and capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Oenothera rubricauloides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
